1.content:
I took a quick look at my watch as I stepped out of one of the bathroom stalls; sighing when I realized I had 10 minutes before I had to meet my mom out front. Holding my dirty gym clothes in one hand, I started back towards the locker area. On my way I stopped by one of my teammates as she was icing her ankle. “Sorry again for what happened, Amber.”

Amber and I were among several girls practicing a routine for the upcoming Homecoming game. She had just finished her part of the routine, which involved doing a flip in midair, when I slipped on a patch of wet grass while trying to catch her. I ended up on my back while she landed awkwardly on her ankle. “Don’t apologize, Cass; none of us knew that patch of grass was wet.” Looking up at me, holding the ice pack in one hand, Amber said, “Besides it’s just a twisted ankle, I’ll be fine before you know it.”

“I still feel bad about it.” Sighing, I said, “Whose bright idea was it to practice on the field right after a thunderstorm, anyway?”

Just than another squad mate, Kelsey Rogers, came walking over to us. After exchanging a look with Amber, she turned to me and said, “A few of us are heading to the mall to look at Homecoming dresses, you in?”

Looking at my watch to see that I now had 5 minutes to get out front, I said, “I’d love to, but my parents are forcing me to see a therapist and my first sessions in like 20 minutes.” Sighing, I said, “I’ll probably go shopping with Kat and Melanie after school tomorrow.”

Amber and Kelsey exchanged looks again, before turning back to me. With a curious look on her face, Amber said, “Why are your folks sending to therapy? Does it have something to do with your accident?”

I had a particularly life-altering experience a month ago, just prior to the start of school; one that changed my life in a very profound way. I quickly bounced back but I guess my parents and, to a lesser extent, my older brother thought that happened too quickly. “Yeah, they’re worried I’m still in denial about the whole thing.” Sighing, I said, “Is it bad that I’ve already come to terms with what happened?”

“Honestly; it’s more weird than bad.” Looking at me, Kelsey said, “If I were in your position, I don’t know that I’d have moved on this quickly.”

Just then my smart watch started vibrating, I looked down and saw a text from my mom – Where are you? We’re going to be late. Walking past them, towards my locker, I said, “You sound a lot like my mom; but I’ll tell you what I told her – I’m fine.”

“I don’t know; it sounds to me like you’re in denial about this whole thing.”

After grabbing my things from my locker and putting on my Greenville Cheer jacket, I said my goodbyes and left the locker room. No sooner had I left the locker room when I heard a familiar voice calling my name. Turning around I saw my best friends Kat and Melanie Maddox approaching me. Despite being identical twins, they were total opposites in terms of personality; Kat was feminine while Melanie had a more masculine energy. No one at school knew this; but Melanie was a lesbian and dating a girl from a neighboring town.

I knew from the look on Kat’s face that she had something to say; being short on time, I said, “I don’t have time to talk, Kat; I’m running late for an appointment I didn’t want in the first place.”

Walking to catch up with me, Kat said, “I know; I just wanted to make sure we were still on for tomorrow.”

“Are you kidding?” looking at them both, a smile on my face, I said, “I’m not passing up the opportunity to see Mel in a dress.”

In all the years I’d known them, I’d only rarely seen Melanie wear anything remotely feminine. It was as if she had an aversion to them. “Yeah, about that.” Sighing as she looked at the two of us, Melanie said, “I was thinking of wearing a tux.”

Both Kat and I stopped in our tracks; looking at her sister, surprised, Kat said, “Sis, you promised both of us you’d wear a dress.”

“Come on, Mel; even I’m going to be wearing one.” Pausing, I said, “It’s not going to kill you to wear a dress for one night.”

Looking around to make sure the hallway was empty, Kat leaned in and said, “Besides; don’t you think a tux would be a bit of a
giveaway?”

Melanie looked at the two of us for a moment; eventually realizing that we weren’t going to back down. “God you guys can be so annoying sometimes.” Sighing, Melanie said, “If it’ll shut you both up, I’ll wear a damn dress to homecoming.”

We’d reached the main entrance at that point; I could see Mom’s car out front. Rushing out the door, I looked back and said, “Great, I’ll text you guys later on.”

11.content:
Once I got into the car, I wasn’t surprised when Mom started lecturing me. “You better hope we don’t run into traffic, young lady.” Turning to me as we left the parking lot, “You’re lucky we were able to get you an appointment at the last minute.”

“I don’t think lucky is the correct word, Mom; I didn’t even want this appointment in the first place.” Sighing, I said, “Why won’t everyone just believe me when I say that I’m fine?”

“I don’t see how anyone can be fine so soon after experiencing what you did.” Glancing at me as she turned into traffic, Mom said, “Even if you turn out to be fine, what’s the harm in having a little therapy?”

My attention was momentarily focused on the sight of a familiar boy walking down the street holding his football equipment. Jeff Anderson was the same age as my brother Glenn; and as you no doubt figured out, he was on the football team. From the first time I saw him, I felt giddy every time I ran into him.

I watched him until we drove around the corner, turning back to find Mom looking at me. “What?”

With a sincere smile on her face, Mom said, “Is that the boy you’re interested in?”

I didn’t want to admit it, but she was right. “Yeah, that’s him.”

“He seems like a nice boy; why don’t you ask him out?”

I’d be lying if I said that thought hadn’t occurred to me; but, as far as I was concerned, the chances of him saying yes were non-existent. “Please; like he’d even give me the time of day.” Looking at Mom, scoffing, I said, “Besides; a cheerleader dating a football player sounds so cliché.”

************************************


We arrived at Shoreline Family Therapy a few minutes later; I begrudgingly went in alone while Mom drove off to do some quick errands. I’d barely had a chance to check in before the therapist, a young woman in her mid-twenties, walked out of a nearby room. Looking at me, she said, “You must be Cassidy Scott.”

I was the only one in the room apart from the receptionist; I couldn’t help but look at her with a ‘duh’ look on my face. “Yeah, I’m Cassidy Scott; what gave it away?”

Choosing to ignore my comment, she said, “Come on in and have a seat.”

I followed the therapist into the room and took a seat on her couch; noting with interest the way she was looking at my jacket. I started to feel a little self-conscious, wondering if there was something wrong with my outfit. “Why are you staring at me like that?”

“Sorry, I didn’t mean to stare.” Taking a seat across from me, she said, “I went to Oak Grove High; I was on the cheer squad when we won regionals 6 years ago.”

We ended up spending almost twenty minutes just talking; I learned her name was Grace Connelly, she was 24 years old and had been the captain of my squad her senior year. “I don’t mean to be rude, considering I didn’t want to come here in the first place, but we’ve spent the last 20 minutes talking about cheerleading.”

“Fair enough.” Grabbing a notepad, Dr. Connelly said, “So Cassidy, why don’t you want to be here today?”

Letting out of a heavy sigh, I said, “Because this is all big waste of time; my family just needs to move on.”

“Move on from what, exactly?” looking at me, Dr. Connelly said, “Did something happen recently?”

“Yeah, you could say that; I had an accident last month that changed my life.” Looking up at the ceiling for a moment, I said, “My family seems to think that I’ve adapted to everything too quickly.”

Jotting something down on her notepad, Dr. Connelly said, “You seem in perfect health, so was the accident really as dramatic as you’re making it out to be?”

“I didn’t say anything about broken bones, Doctor; I said it changed my life.” giving off an exasperated sigh, I said, “Trust me when I say it changed everything about me; even my name.”

“I see.” I could tell that Dr. Connelly was becoming more interested in what I was saying. “What was your name before this accident?”

I soon realized there was no undoing what was about to happen; once it was out there, there was no taking it back. Taking a deep breath, I looked at her and said, “My name was Marcus.”

“Marcus?” looking at me, confused, Dr. Connelly said, “Forgive me, but is that a family name? I’ve never met a girl named Marcus before.”

“That’s the thing, Doc; I wasn’t a girl before the accident.” Looking at her, I said, “I was a boy; head to toe and all points in between.”

Dr. Connelly was silent for a few moments as she tried to process what I’d just told her. Eventually she cleared her throat and said, “Are you messing with me right now?” looking me over, in disbelief, she said, “There’s no way you used to be a boy.”

“I wouldn’t believe me either; but I’m telling the truth.” Digging my phone from my purse, I said, “It was, without a doubt, the single most painful thing I’ve ever experienced.”

I opened the photo gallery on my phone and handed it to Dr. Connelly. The phone in her hand, she said, “What am I looking at?”

“Those are photos one of my classmates took; showing the initial stages of the transformation.”

After looking through the plethora of photos, Dr. Connelly handed the phone back to me. “Forgive me, but how exactly did all that happen?”

“Well, it all started about a month ago...”

111.content:
The day my life changed forever started out as a normal day; there was no sign at all of what was coming. I woke up to the sound of my mom knocking first on my brother Glenn’s door and then mine, sayings, “Wake up boys, we have to be at the doctor’s office in 45 minutes.”

Today was going to be a busy day for me; Mom was taking Glenn and I to the doctor to make sure we were up to date on our shots, then I was going to Freshman Orientation. Groaning as I got out of bed, I said to myself, “Please let this be a stress-free day.”

Coming out of my bedroom, I started walking down the hall as Glenn came out of his room. Looking at me, he said, “Hey little bro, you excited to start high school?”

“Yeah, I guess so.” Shrugging as we both entered the bathroom, I said, “I don’t see the point of going to Orientation; after all, you didn’t go last year.”

Taking a seat on the toilet while I started brushing my teeth, Glenn said, “I didn’t go last year because I’d just broken my leg, remember?” looking at me, Glenn said, “Besides, the point of Orientation is to meet new people.”

“How am I going to meet new people, if I’ve known everyone since the 6th grade?”

“Okay, you got me there.” Flushing the toilet, Glenn said, “It just wouldn’t hurt to expand your social circle beyond Kat and Melanie.”

“What’s wrong with Kat and Melanie?” turning to Glenn, I said, “They’ve been my best friends since we moved to the neighborhood.”

“There’s nothing wrong with them, Marcus; it’s just I can’t help think you’re spending too much time with them.” Gesturing to my waist, Glenn said, “You’re even starting to use some of Kat’s mannerisms.”

Looking down, I saw that Glenn was right; I’d placed my hands on my waist in the same way that Kat loved to do. Crossing my arms, I said, “Does this have anything to do with Melanie refusing to date you?”

Glenn has had a crush on Melanie for the better part of two years; he’d flirt with her every chance he got. The three of us couldn’t believe that Glenn had no clue Melanie was a lesbian; nothing short of her kissing her girlfriend in front of him would knock some sense into him.

“We’d be absolutely perfect together; but she won’t give me the time of day.” Chuckling, I said, “Am I not her type or something?”
It was all I could do not to tell Glenn the truth, but I figured it wasn’t my place to do so. “Why don’t you just ask her, once and for all, why she keeps shooting you down.”

As the two of us walked out of the bathroom, back towards our rooms, Glenn said, “Fine, I’ll ask her.” Stopping outside his door, Glenn said, “Just promise me you’ll try to make some more friends?”

“Fine, I promise.”
111.title: One Month Earlier (Where It All Began)

1111.content:
My arm was feeling particularly tender as Mom drove into the school parking lot. Looking at Glenn, I figured his was tender as well because of the way he was holding his arm. There was a new vaccine regimen that involved injecting a person with several vaccines at once. One of the possible side-effects was that the injection site would be sore for a while.

As we came to a stop in front of the school, I saw Melanie and Kat standing nearby. After saying goodbye to Mom, Glenn and I got out to join them. Seeing me holding my arm, Melanie said, “What’s up with your arm, Marcus?”

“It’s a little tender from the vaccinations.” Gesturing to Glenn, I said, “You should’ve seen Glenn here, he was actually whimpering as they injected him.”

The look on Glenn’s face quickly turned red with embarrassment as he turned to Melanie. “H-He’s lying; I didn’t do anything like that.” Smiling, Glenn said, “I’m a big strong guy.”

We all knew where this was heading as Melanie groaned and turned to Glenn. “This has gone on long enough, Glenn.” Sighing, she said, “I’m not interested in dating you, so why don’t you just give up.”

Glenn was never one to back down from a challenge; and that was certainly the case today. “Mel, come on, we’d be great together.” Looking desperate, Glenn said, “Why won’t you give us a chance?”

Kat and I exchanged amused glances with one another while Melanie looked at Glenn, “We’ve got too much in common, Glenn; it wouldn’t work out.”

Glenn was struggling to understand Melanie’s meaning, as he said, “I don’t understand.”

Melanie wasn’t quite ready to come out publicly; so, when she saw a group of students walking by, she leaned over and whispered, “I like girls.”

As soon as Glenn heard that, his eyes went wide, “Oh.”

“Marcus and Kat have known for the better part of a year.” Looking at him in disbelief, Melanie said, “I can’t believe you didn’t pick up on it.”

Glenn turned to me with an angry look; as he said, “You knew and didn’t tell me?”

With a grin, I looked at him and said, “Honestly, it was fun watching you embarrass yourself.”

I watched as Glenn made a fist with one hand; I knew he would never hit me, but I instinctively took a step back. After a moment, Glenn relaxed and said, “Come on, let’s go inside.”
1111.title: Arriving at Orientation

11111.content:
As we walked inside, I found myself feeling sorry for Glenn. He’d been pining for Melanie for almost two years, only to have his dreams dashed to pieces. While I went to sign in with Kat and Melanie, Glenn went off to meet up with his fellow student guides.

It came as no surprise when we were split into separate groups; I stayed with Kat while Melanie was placed with another group. Kat and I stood in the hallway with the 6 remaining members of the group, waiting for our guide to show up. When he did, I noticed that Kat and the other girls instantly took an interest in him.

After introducing himself as Jeff, we began the tour of the building. It wasn’t until we’d been walking for about 10 minutes that it started to dawn on me why Kat and the other girls were interested in Jeff. He was handsome in a rugged sort of way, not too muscular but not chubby either.

********************************


The orientation tour lasted about an hour; Jeff took us to every key area of the school. Once that was finished, we all gathered in the cafeteria for a quick lunch before we went home. By the time we caught up with them, Melanie and Glenn were already seated and eating their lunches.

“Geez, what took you guys so long?” Putting her sandwich down, Melanie said, “I thought the tours were only supposed to take 45 minutes.”

As we took our seats, I gestured to Kat and said, “Every girl in the group, including your sister, was practically drooling over our guide.”

Melanie was practically rolling her eyes; saying, “My twin sister, ladies and gentlemen – a sucker for every attractive guy she sees.”

“Oh please, perhaps I should tell Amanda how you were focusing on your guide’s chest.” Ignoring the death stare that she was receiving from Melanie, Kat said, “Besides, can you blame me? Jeff was pretty easy on the eyes.”

I was in the middle of taking a bite of my sandwich, but that didn’t some me from nodding and saying, “Hear, hear.”

Before I could even process what I’d just said, Glenn was standing next to me. “Guys don’t talk like that about other guys unless they’re into that sort of thing.” Whispering into my ear, he said, “You definitely need to find some guy friends, you’re starting to talk too much like Kat.”

The hits just kept on coming at that point as I suddenly started feeling achy and feverish. The closest one to me, Kat said, “Marc, are you feeling alright?”

“I’m be okay.” Wiping the sweat from my forehead, while clutching my stomach, I said, “Hopefully, they'll have the AC fixed soon."

Everyone looked at me in confusion, while Kat said, “What are you talking about, the AC is fine. If anything, it should be a little cooler in here."

That’s when I realized that I was the only one sweating. I started to speak but suddenly keeled over as the pain in my stomach got 100x worse. A large crowd started to gather around me as I screamed in pain. Some people asked if I was okay as Kat and Melanie tried to clear people away while Glenn was on the phone.

I could barely hear Kat as she yelled, “Let him breathe!”

Breathing wasn’t a problem; it was everything else that seemed to be affected. Having just gotten off the phone, Glenn knelt next to me and said, “You’re going to be okay, Marc; the EMTs are on the way.”

Suddenly someone in the crowd let out a shocked gasp, while Kat looked down at me, “Marc, you look...different.”

Since I couldn’t see myself, I had no idea what she was talking about. Standing next to her sister, in shock, Melanie said, “Your hair is getting longer, and your face...”

I didn’t hear the end of that sentence because my attention was suddenly focused on a tightness in my chest. Looking down, I couldn’t believe what I was seeing – my chest was swelling as two mounds of flesh start growing under my shirt. What the hell? Am I growing breasts?

That’s the last thing I remembered before passing out from the pain.
11111.title: Orientation & Lunch

111111.content:
The first thing I became of as I regained consciousness was the new, and disturbing, weight on my chest. My groans must’ve alerted someone because I suddenly heard Glenn’s voice nearby, “Look who’s finally waking up.”

My memory was fuzzy, so I couldn’t completely remember what happened earlier. I opened my eyes just as I felt an intense wave of discomfort. Turning towards the sound of Glenn’s voice, I was surprised to see him lying in a nearby hospital bed with an IV in his arm. “Glenn? Are you all right?”

The first thing I noticed was that my voice sounded different; it was higher pitched and sounded almost angelic. The second thing I noticed was the look on Glenn’s face; a mixture of horror and sadness. “I’m fine, this is just a precaution.” Looking at me, he said, “Are you alright?”

I was keenly aware of both the weight on my chest and my higher-pitched voice, but I couldn’t explain any of it. “I don’t know; the last thing I remember was doubling over in pain at school.” Chuckling, I said, “I must’ve been dreaming because I swear that I saw breasts underneath my shirt.”

“I’m afraid it wasn’t a dream, Marcus.” Sitting up in bed, his voice all serious, Glenn said, “Why don’t you look down.”

Suddenly overwhelmed with trepidation, I looked down and my jaw dropped – staring at me from underneath a hospital gown was a pair of large, and very real, breasts. Before I knew what was happening, I blacked out and fell back onto the pillow.

***********************************


When I woke up again, the room was empty save for me and my mom. As she looked at me with concern in her eyes, I said, “I-I just had this weird dream…that I’d somehow grown breasts.”

“The doctors aren’t sure how it happened yet, sweetie.” Moving closer, digging through her purse, Mom handed me something and said, “Take a look.”

I looked and saw the picture of a teenage girl. Turning back to Mom, I was about to ask what was going on when I noticed something out of the corner of my eye. Looking back at the photo, I saw that the girl suddenly looked confused – as confused as I felt. Turing my attention to Mom, as reality slowly began to dawn on me, I said, “M-Mom?”

“Honey…”

It suddenly occurred to me that Mom had yet to call me by my name; instead, she kept calling me sweetie or honey. A sudden itch brought my hand up to my nose. It wasn’t until I saw the girl scratching her nose that I realized this wasn’t a picture in my hand.

I looked at mom in stunned silence as she nodded in understanding. “I’m afraid it wasn’t a dream, Marcus. The doctors aren’t sure what happened; but, somehow, you’ve been turned into a girl.”

The feel of losing my grip on mom’s compact, and the sound of it hitting the floor, was the last thing I remembered before blacking out again.
111111.title: Waking Up

1111111.content:
Mom and I weren’t alone the next time I woke up; Glenn was back in his bed while Dad was standing in the corner having a heated conversation with a doctor. Mom was trying her best to keep him calm, but it was a futile gesture. Judging from the bags under her eyes, I figured the doctor had be on the clock for a while; the last thing she needed was to be berated by my dad. “My son turns into a girl in front of 100 people, and you can’t even give me an explanation for why it happened?”

As more of my memory started coming back, I remembered being in the cafeteria when I started to experience the worst pain of my life. No one seemed to realize that I was awake again; however, before I could do anything about that, Glenn spoke up, “Hey guys, she’s awake.”

Only a few hours, at most, had passed since the orientation; I barely had time to process what happened and my older brother was already referring to me as a girl. I gave Glenn a pained expression while the others rushed over to my bedside. I started squirming a little when Mom gave me a big hug, leading Dad to say, “Elaine stop, you’re suffocating her.”

The pained expression returned when I heard Dad call me ‘her,’ although it was soon replaced by a look of relief when Mom released me from her clutches. While her hug had made it difficult for me to breathe, I didn’t much care for the feeling of my breasts being squeezed. Looking at everyone, while I moved to sit up in bed, I said, “Can someone please explain what happened?” pausing, I said, “Last time I checked, it wasn’t possible for something like this to happen.”

Mom and Dad both turned to the doctor, who slowly stepped forward and said, “We’re running every conceivable test we can think of, Marcus.” Sighing, she said, “For now we’re working on the assumption that you were injected with something when you were vaccinated earlier.”

Glenn and I both went pale when we heard that; we were both thinking the same thing. Turning my attention back to the doctor, “We both had the same shots, so why did I turn into a girl and Glenn didn’t?”

“We’re unsure why Glenn wasn’t affected the same way you were; for now, we’re keeping him here for observation.” Trying her best to look reassuring, the doctor said, “The best case scenario is that you were unlucky, and your brother will be fine; worst case is that you’ll end up with an older sister.”

Neither of us said a word while Mom and Dad turned to the doctor. Looking justifiably concerned, Mom said, “What’s going to happen now, Doctor Somers?”

“That’s entirely up to your...daughter, ma’am.” Sighing, Dr. Somers said, “We can give her some time to process this, or we can take her for some tests to figure out what caused this.”

Everyone turned their attention to me, which made me feel extremely uncomfortable. I was never a fan of making major decisions, and this one certainly qualified. After taking a moment to process everything, I sighed and said, “I’d like ______.”
1111111.title: Learning What Happened

11111111.content:
Despite ample evidence to the contrary, I’d spend the last 14 years of my life as a guy; one who was attracted to girls. I’d be lying if I said the chance to examine a female body up close wasn’t appealing. Looking around the room at everyone, I said, “If you don’t mind, I think I’d like a few minutes alone.”

Most everyone was understanding, save for Glenn. He glanced at me for a moment before turning to Mom, “Why does Marcus need to be alone?”

Mom looked at me for a moment before she turned her attention to Glenn. “Glenn, your new sister wants to have some privacy; just as I’m sure you’d want if this happened to you.” Gently helping him from the bed, Mom said, “Now let’s give her some privacy, as she requested.”

Glenn’s face was blank as he slowly walked towards the door; only to turn and look at me once he realized what Mom was talking about. Seeing the shocked look in his eyes made me blush even more; the last thing I needed right now was him picturing me examining my body.

The shocked expression remained on Glenn’s face as he left the room with Dad and Dr. Somers. Mom stayed behind for a moment, sitting on the edge of my bed. The way she was looking at me only served to make me blush even more. Taking my hand in hers, Mom said, “It’s alright sweetie, there’s nothing to be embarrassed about.”

“That’s easy for you to say mom; you’ve been a girl your whole life.” Blushing, I said, “I never figured the first naked girl I saw would be me.”

Mom leaned over and kissed me on the forehead before getting to her feet. “I’ll be right outside if you need anything.”

“Mom! This is embarrassing enough as it is, I don’t want your help.”

“I figured you’d say that; but thought I’d mention it anyway.” Giving my hand an affectionate squeeze, Mom said, “We’ll be outside when you’re ready.”

Once I was finally alone it took me a few minutes to get up the courage to walk into the bathroom. When I finally got out of bed, I quickly noticed that I was somehow shorter than this morning. I wondered what could’ve affected my height when I realized there were more pressing matters to attend to.

I slowly walked into the bathroom and closed the door; taking a deep breath, I turned to face my reflection in the mirror. Even though I’d already seen it through my mom’s compact, seeing my new reflection in a larger mirror was still a shock. My hair, which I’d always kept on the short side was now down just past my shoulders; and I swear it had gotten just a little lighter as well.

I spent a few minutes looking at my body from every conceivable angle before I finally got up the courage to strip naked. Once I did that, I was faced with the realization that I looked like a younger version of my mom, down to the large breasts and curvaceous figure. I had to remind myself that the girls on my mom’s side tended to develop early, which explained why I was more developed than the average 14-year-old.

After fondling my breasts for a few minutes, I decided to turn my attention down below. I slowly brought my hand down and started to explore; overwhelmed with a plethora of new, and pleasurable, sensations. Due in large part to my inexperience with the female form, my exploration led to a sudden, and embarrassingly loud, moan escaping my lips.

I quickly covered my mouth in embarrassment, as I was certain it had been loud enough for people to hear it outside. Not wanting to cause any more problems, I promptly got dressed and left the room. As I walked into the hall, I noticed Dad and Glenn both had looks of embarrassment on their faces as they turned to look away from me.

I started to blush from embarrassment as Mom and Dr. Somers both gave me sympathetic looks. Placing a hand on my shoulder, Mom said, “You’ve got nothing to be ashamed of, sweetie; what you did is perfectly normal for a girl your age.”

Still feeling embarrassed, I looked at Mom and said, “Thanks Mom.”
11111111.title: Some Alone Time

111111111.content:
We soon found ourselves in a small window-less room in the center of the hospital. Glenn, who couldn’t even look at me, and I noticed two examination tables in the center of the room. Turning to Dr. Somers, I said, “What’s going on, why are there two tables?”

Gesturing to a lab assistant standing nearby, Dr. Somers said, “We’re going to be examining both you and your brother at the same time.” Patting her hand on one of the beds, her way of telling me to take a seat, she said, “We want to figure out why you changed and your brother didn’t; as well as determining whether or not he will change in the future.”

As Glenn and I each sat down on our own table, I looked at him and said, “It’s going to be alright, Glenn.”

“That’s easy for you to say, you already changed.” Sighing, without even looking at me, Glenn said, “My fate is still up in the air.”

A frown flashed across my face as I tried to understand Glenn’s sudden change in attitude towards me. Mom must’ve sensed my dismay, because she came over and said, “It’s alright sweetie, your brother will come around eventually.”

“Are you sure, Mom?” looking at her, in a hushed tone, I said, “Neither Dad nor Glenn have been able to look at me since I came out of the bathroom.”
“I’ll have a talk with them about that later.” Kissing my forehead, Mom said, “Try to forget about that for now, alright?”

***********************************


Glenn and I spent the next two hours being poked and prodded; while Dr. Somers and her assistant ran every conceivable test to figure out what happened to me. They took half a dozen vials of blood from each of us to run various blood tests.

Dr. Somers eventually had all the information she’d need for the time being; while the assistant brought the vials to be tested, she walked over to us. As if being a girl wasn’t bad enough, I noticed myself watching the lab assistant as he left the room – especially his muscular arms.

I found myself briefly imagining those arms holding me tight; an image that I quickly pushed to the back of my mind. If anyone noticed anything out of the ordinary, they didn’t say anything. As she stood behind the exam tables with Dad, Mom said, “What can you tell us, Dr. Somers?”

“Not much I’m afraid.” Sighing, she said, “We’ll have to wait until the bloodwork comes back to know more.”

Hearing that, I said, “Does that mean we can go back to our room now?”

“Not quite yet, Marcus.” Exchanging a look with my mom, Dr. Somers said, “Your brother is free to leave, but I’m afraid you need to remain here for more tests.”

Giving me a quick look, Glenn turned to Dr. Somers and said, “I thought you said the tests were finished; why does Marcus need to say?”

“I’m afraid there’s one more test I need to run; one which you or your father shouldn’t be here for.”

1111111111111111111.title: Dropping a Bombshell

11111111111111111111.title: What Did I Get Myself Into?

111111111111111111111.content:
Once I got into one my mom’s one-piece bathing suits, I ended up standing in front of the mirror for what felt like an eternity. Even more than my earlier outfit, seeing myself in a form fitting bathing suit just served to hammer home the fact that I was now a girl. There was no bulge in my crotch, the suit emphasized my already noticeable figure, and the material made my breasts feel weird.

Suddenly, I heard the door open behind me; I turned to find Mom poking her head into her room. “The others are all downstairs waiting for you; are you alright?”

“Yeah, I guess so.” Going over to sit on my parent’s bed, I said, “This is all just a lot to take in; so much as has changed in such a short amount of time.”

“You’ve been through something no one else has ever experienced, sweetie. Although,” looking at me, she said, “I’m sure there would be quite a few people who’d love to experience it.”

I knew what Mom meant, and she was right; the trans community would probably love to experience what I’ve been through. As I leaned my head on Mom’s shoulder, I felt...well, loved. I’m sure the last 24 hours hadn’t been easy for my family; but if they had any problems with it, they didn’t show it. Instead, they’d shown me nothing but love and support.

For a fleeting moment, I considered coming clean to Mom about my interest in boys; but felt the timing wasn’t right. Instead, looking at her, I said, “I love you, Mom.”

“I love you too, sweetie.” Kissing my forehead, Mom said, “I want you to know; you can always come to me for any reason. You’re my daughter, and I’ll love you no matter what.”

Had I given myself time to think about what Mom said, I would’ve realized what she was hinting at. But instead, I got up and said, “Thanks, Mom.”

As I walked out onto the pool deck a few minutes later, I saw that everyone else was already there – including, to my embarrassment, Glenn. Everyone stopped what they were doing to look at me as I stepped out the door; Kat was smiling, while both Amanda and Melanie were fixated on my chest. I was okay with all of it, except for the look that Glenn was giving me – his mouth agape and a look in his eyes like he’d died and gone to heaven.

I was about to call him out on that, until Melanie came up from behind and smacked upside the head. “That’s your sister, dummy.”

“Sorry,” rubbing the back of his head, Glenn looked at me and said, “It’s going to take time for me to adjust to all this.”

“It’s okay, I’d probably act the same way in your position.” Making my way past him, I said, “I don’t mean to be rude, or anything; but do you mind leaving? I’d like to spend time with my girlfriends without my older brother around.”

For a fleeting moment, Glenn looked as if he was going to argue; but instead he silently nodded and went back inside. Once he was gone, Amanda walked over and said, “That suit looks great on you, Cass; even if you borrowed it from your mom.”
111111111111111111111.title: Pool Time, Part 1

1111111111111111111111.content:
I was standing atop the dive board at the pool’s deep end, staring down at the water below me. While Kat and Melanie were already in the water, Amanda was standing behind me. “Come on Cass, you can do it; just dive in and get it over with.”

It wasn’t out of fear of the water, as I’d been swimming since I was 3 years old; rather it was because I was nervous about being in the water in my new body. I’m sure some of it was exaggerated, but I’d always heard stories of how sensitive a girl’s skin was to water.

1111111111111111111111.title: Pool Time, Part 2

I never realized until now just how much girls had to do after getting out of the shower; I’d always assumed that they did the same thing as boys – just dry off and you’re done.
